$$x = 0.3 / 2.4 = 0.13$$

Now, I will substitute the values of $x$ and $y$ into one of the equations to verify that the result is true. Let me plug in $x = 0.13$ and $y = -0.81$ into the first equation:

$$2.4(0.13) - 1.5(-0.81) = 0.3$$

Simplifying, I get:

$$0.32 - 1.21 = 0.3$$

Which is true.

Therefore, the $x$-coordinate of the intersection point is $0.13$.
